segments.text: I can't believe what I'm seeing, the sink is overflowing and no one seems to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring out, creating a puddle on the floor, and the woman is standing right in it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a bit angry that she's so absorbed in drying that plate, completely oblivious to the mess around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are focused on the cookie jar, not paying any attention to the water either.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's like they're all in their own little worlds, not noticing the chaos around them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long this has been going on, the water overflowing like that.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone notices soon, before it causes any real damage.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy on the stool is reaching for the cookies, completely unaware of the water or the unstable stool beneath him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's like a recipe for disaster, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a bit helpless, just watching it all unfold without being able to intervene.
segments.speaker: PAR
